article.description: Bryson Scott scored 16 points, Charles Ruise Jr. had 15 on 5-of-7 shooting, and Xzavier Taylor added 14 points as IPFW dismantled NAIA-member Siena Heights 107-59 on Monday night.
article.headline: IPFW handles Siena Heights 107-59 behind Scott's 16
article.linkText: IPFW handles Siena Heights 107-59 behind Scott's 16
article.story: FORT WAYNE, Ind. -- Bryson Scott scored 16 points, Charles Ruise Jr. had 15 on 5-of-7 shooting, and Xzavier Taylor added 14 points as IPFW dismantled NAIA-member Siena Heights 107-59 on Monday night. IPFW led 54-36 at halftime and used an 18-0 run out of the break to put the game away. The Mastodons shot 8 for 11, while Siena Heights missed all 10 of its field-goal attempts, during the run. Scott, the reigning Summit League Player of the Week, entered the game shooting 62.9 percent from the floor. He went 6-for-8 shooting against the Saints from Adrian, Michigan. The Mastodons shot 61.5 percent from the floor (40 for 65). IPFW (5-2) entered the game 18th in the nation in steals with 55 and collected 10 more against Siena Heights. Carter Drazga was the only Saints player in double figures, hitting 3-of-4 3s and scoring 11 points in just 15 minutes of action.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
